text.p: These are the main stories in Slovenia's Monday morning newspapers.
- There are two Slovenians on the list of unclaimed Swiss bank accounts.
- Slovenian athletes won no medals at the European Youth Athletic Championships in Ljubljana, which ended on Sunday.
- Slovenia's largest bank Nova Ljubljanska Banka has stopped processing payments over the Internet with its Eurocards because of possible misuse.
- Hail on Saturday caused a lot of damange to fields around the city of Krsko, southeast of Ljubljana.
- Parliament is expected to debate the partial privatisation of Slovenian Ironworks before going on holiday in August.
- Some 35.3 percent of Slovenians believe that Foreign Minister Zoran Thaler is successful while 24.9 percent claim the opposite.
- 1997 budget spending is expected to reach 737 billion tolars ($4.4 billion), up from the previously expected figure of 730 billion.
- The Ministry of Transport said it has so far received nine applications for permission to operate a mobile telephone network in Slovenia. Currently only state-owned Mobitel has a licence to do so.
